content:
On my mac, I was using ISabelle and it just shut down with no warning -- perhaps because there were network glitches happening or something. I needed to restart the laptop anyhow and went from 2025 RC2 to the 2025 release -- I installed, opened it according to the instructions to deal with security stuff...and it shut down instantly. So I tried Isabelle 2024, which I still had installed...and it did the same thing.

I suspect something like the list of recently opened items, or the most recent item, is somehow screwed up. Does anyone know where this is stored on a Mac, so thatI can reset it perhaps?

Normally I'd look for something like ~/.isabellerc, but I didn't see anything obvious.
Can you start it in the terminal and see if there is any error message?
Thanks. I'll give both of these a try. I'm not sure how I missed ~/.isabelle ... needed more coffee, I guess.

I removed the whole ~/.isabelle directory, and then moved all three versions of Isabelle from the Applications folder to the trash, and re-downloaded Isabelle2025. I restarted the computer as well. Then I installed Isabelle2025, tried to run it, dealt with the security/privacy settings issue, and tried again...after which it shut down instantly, same as before. I did try running it from the command line, but couldn't figure out the correct invocation, alas. (I also used the Mac's task-manager-equivalent to look for any processes that might be left over from a previous invocation of Isabelle, but didn't see any.)
The invocation you are looking for would simply be .../isabelle jedit

Running isabelle jedit seems to work fine. But doube-clicking on the Isabelle-2025 icon in the Applications folder still quits more or less immediately.

I append here the report that Apple generates for this failed attempt:
